comments:
I am using eclipse 3.2M1. But this phenomenon was seen in R3.1 as well.
 
for no apparent reason eclipse did not allow me to Open Project for closed 
Project sometimes, the context menu item was grayed out, or even had no "Open 
Project" context menu item. Afte restart the Eclipse, I could solve this 
problem. But it will come back after restarting of eclipse several times.

This problem seem to appear randomly but some times per day. So I hope Eclipse 
team can do some researches on this problem, and solve it. I like Eclipse very 
much:)

Notes: 
my OS - XP
JDK - JAVA 5 (maybe it's the problem?I will test this)
If need, I could provide some snapshots about this problem:)

I believe this is a dupe but I can't find the original bug.  I THOUGHT it had been fixed some time ago, 
possibly in the 3.1 timeframe.
Can you attach your error log?

(In reply to comment #2)
> Can you attach your error log? 
>

My Eclipse SDK version(3.2M1):
Version: 3.1.0
Build id: I20050811-1530

In fact, I found this problem before several months when I use R3.1. I guessed 
it could be reported and fixed in 3.2M1. But not^_^ Yesterday I met a thread in 
a IBM web forum which said the same problem. So, I believe it's not a 
individual case:) 

I guess 2 reasons for this problem:
1>Java5?(I using JDK 1.5.0_05-b05, but I have met this problem under 
b02/b03/b04)
2>plugin conflict?(But Most of plugins of my using is delivered to R3.1)
this looks a lot like bug 68179

I recheck the error log and make some tests. I highly guess this is the plugin 
conflict problem. I am using oxygen 6.1 plugin to deal with xml files. Today I 
disabled/re-enabled the oxygen. I have not met this phenomenon again. So, maybe 
it's just a small problem(due to the plugin, not the Eclipse itself^_^). I will 
make more tests recently. I hope the bug could be closed soon^_^

Today I make more tests. I am very sure that the oxygen xml editor plugin crash 
the "Open Project" context item of Eclipse. It should be not the bug of 
Eclipse. Sorry for disturbing. I like Eclipse really^_^ How to close this bug 
thread?I think it can be closed^_^

Closing this bug as INVALID as the bug is being logged against a different
product.  Thank you for investigating and clarifying this issue.
